SENT.plain: Two pregnant patients with a sustained symptomatic maternal supraventricular arrhythmia are presented
Both patients were treated with direct-current cardioversion
Electrical cardioversion during pregnancy is a rarely applied but highly effective procedure in the treatment of maternal cardiac arrhythmias and is assumed safe for both mother and child
However, once foetal viability is reached, monitoring of the foetal heart rate is advised and facilities for immediate caesarean section should be available
